topics.body:
I have a (not so much) a problem.

I have two choices for my future.

a) I can go to Germany to study Engineering; this will take 5 years.
b) I can go to Japan to study Engineering; 2 years for foundation and another 5 years in Japan, making a total of 7 years.

Which choice should I make? 
Because I really want to study in Japan but everyone keeps persisting me that what I want isn't important compared to the time taken.
topics.author: 4fe1b9f47f123b13df002976

topics.body: !https://36.media.tumblr.com/d8c101378ded8f1f029174563a189710/tumblr_neluc7c6K21r8lde5o1_1280.png!
topics.author: 5062d6f17f123b3e16001184

topics.body:
"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55135664636872041c552200#post_55135664636872041c552200
I say go to Germany. Japan isn't nearly as cool as their pop culture makes it look.

Plus Germany has better music and food.
topics.author: 4f41ee04945b701c41002af7

topics.body:
"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55135664636872041c552200#post_55135664636872041c552200
Just go to Japan if you feel ready.  In other words take the course in Germany.

topics.body:
"@gasmaskangel":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/551356dc63687238e5520300#post_551356dc63687238e5520300
I'm not saying that I don't want to go to Germany.
It's just that I already have a plan.

If I go to Germany, my plan goes up in smoke and I probably have to live my life as an engineer (which isn't as exciting as it sounds). I'm only studying Engineering because of my folks (and the scholarship) but I seriously want to join the entertainment business.
